website_summaries.verdict: Not only does this inexpensive headband magnifier include an array of lenses and accessories to accommodate your specific magnification needs, it’s the only model on our list that includes batteries so you can use it right out of the box.
pros: Swappable head strap and glasses for your preferred fit
Includes carrying case, 3 AAA batteries, and cleaning cloth
cons: While this item is a little on the bulky side, it’s well-worth the low entry price

customer_reviews.title: Happy esthetician-- happy pimple free clients
customer_reviews.text: I'm an esthetician who needed to see closer and better when doing extractions. I may look silly with them on but I'm so happy that I purchased! Just what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for lash artists!
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are far better than the ones I ordered from a pro lash company. My order came on time and the glasses are so nice! I use these for applying lash extensions and I would highly recommend them to other lash artists!
customer_reviews.author: madijane

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable that there are so many good reviews on this site. I found: 1. The batteries won't stay seated 2. The battery cover wouldn't snap into place. 3. The item is made of cheap plastic. 4. The lenses give a slightly distorted view, no matter what at what angle the lenses are worn. This item is far from "professional quality".
customer_reviews.author: snackish

customer_reviews.title: Second hand Product with defect
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and Returned this item because it was defective (right earpiece loose), and it seemed like a returned/regifted item. Most new items are wrapped in cellophane, this was not. And, the Vendor did not refund the whole amount.
customer_reviews.author: kuaina

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy and slide off ....received with missing screw ...will not buy again because of return policy
customer_reviews.author: Lily A.

customer_reviews.title: The lens does NOT lift out of the way.
customer_reviews.text: I do not like them. The lens does not lift up all the way so I have to take them off every time I move from doing close up work to everything else I don’t need glasses for, which is annoying and does not work at all for me as a goldsmith.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome! I can work on my jewelry design again
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! I can work on my jewelry design again! So far so good with the product. I wear glasses so I use the adjustable straps instead of the over the ear bracket. The lens comes in different strength and has it's own protective cartridge and soft cleaning rag. The led lights is BRIGHT! This product is a problem solver. My husband used it too in order to read it's manual...lol Going to order another one for him as well.
customer_reviews.author: The Mathews

customer_reviews.title: but was dirty and had a hair coming out of one of ...
customer_reviews.text: Item works, but was dirty and had a hair coming out of one of the hinges. The box wasn't sealed, so I assume this was a used or return item.
customer_reviews.author: Mfont

customer_reviews.title: Batteries will NOT stay in!!
customer_reviews.text: Well I guess I wasted my money on something I was really looking forward to using for wood burning....I tried to get the batteries in these for literally 15 minutes. Cannot get them to stay in it, pops right back out because springs are bent slightly downwards. I've tried to hold them in while trying to put the lid back on and it will not fit back on. Bad buy for sure. And I really HATE giving bad reviews, but sometimes necessary for a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: BuRny

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product today in the mail. Everything is wrong with it. I have a medium to average size head and its sized to fit a one-year-old. Light doesn't work, lenses too small to be viewed thru to even see if they work, I would have to be cross-eyed or have eyes a half inch apart! Waaay to small for any functional use even if the light worked. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: D R

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but not for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: This item was disappointing, at least for my application. I wanted something to help with hand soldering tiny surface mount parts into PC boards. Problems: 1 as noted elsewhere these will interfere with glasses. 2 Magnification of 3.5 may be OK for craft work, but I need about 5x at least for my app. 3. Although these are well conceived and reasonably well made, there is some distortion in part of the lens viewing area. Annoying and maybe nausea inducing after prolonged use. I think for the type of work I want to do I should have sprung for a more pro unit, possibly with a jewelers loupe.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Sieber

customer_reviews.title: For the money, can't be beat
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand what anyone can say negatively about these... for the money you cannot beat them. No, they aren't laboratory or industrial quality, but for 17 bucks what do you expect? For the average home use, as long as you don't handle your tools like a freaking gorilla, these are outstanding. The multiple lenses are clear, come in a handy container to keep them scratch-free, and attach/detach from the frame easily. The light/headlamp works just fine, perhaps could be a bit brighter but then you'd have to sacrifice the headset's light weight. Has enough room to even wear glasses under the magnification lenses. For the price I have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: ReyAce

customer_reviews.title: Perfect....except
customer_reviews.text: At first use I would have given this 5 stars, however after wearing it for a bit the ridges on the nose pieces really start to annoy me. I'm constantly having to adjust them for comfort. Any suggestions from other users or the company?
customer_reviews.author: skgurley

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Uncomfortable - and I really expected discomfort going in...
customer_reviews.text: So, these definitely try to cut your nose off. The portion that rests on your nose is like poorly coated very hard metal. Its quite thin, so if the bridge of your nose is wide, or basically not a child, it will basically feel like it is slowly cutting off your nose for hours while you work. Basically like the Guantanamo treatment. If you want it, this is the product for you. Yeah, it has elastic straps, but those basically stretch and never contract, eventually leaving an inelastic headband.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas B

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & effective
customer_reviews.text: This impressed me with the degree of comfort, flexibility, and features. I had a head-mount magnifier from Harbor Freight, but I hated using it because it was bulky, heavy, and miserable to wear for more than a minute or two. Not so with the Yoctosun magnifier: it's very comfortable (I prefer the eyeglass legs rather than the strap), and the lens & light angle adjustments mean that everything is visible. Bought it so I could see what I was doing when soldering guitar circuits and building e-cigarette coils/rigs, but I'm sure I'll find additional uses. I wish I'd found this a year or three ago!
customer_reviews.author: heyjohn

customer_reviews.title: It does magnify well
customer_reviews.text: I like the magnification. I was using this to help with threading a needle. The batteries are EXTREMELY hard to place in the holder. 1) because the springs are too loose to properly hold the batteries. 2) the battery holder is very difficult to place the batteries in place. Over all I would not repurchase. This is too expensive and does not meet my expectations. I will keep the item because of the hassle of returning.
customer_reviews.author: The master of one

customer_reviews.title: The nose piece is fine and doesn't leave marks on my face
customer_reviews.text: Fits well. I have a big head and its not tight on the side of my face or temples but it still feels secure. The nose piece is fine and doesn't leave marks on my face. I am able to wear it over my glasses (it looks weird, but it works). The magnifier pieces snap easily in and out with no problems so far. Great quality for the price. The LED light is bright, but there is no manual way to point the light in your desired direction. It's not bad though, it points pretty well in the direction you're looking and its good enough. Arrived quickly and undamaged. I use these for eyelash extension application.
customer_reviews.author: Beth R.

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is very adjustable
customer_reviews.text: This stereo magnifier works very well and is highly adjustable. You can adjust the angle of the lens, the angle of the LED light, and even the focal length. It uses 3 AAA batteries. It also comes with an elastic headband, however I found the ear holders to be sufficiently tight that I didn't need the headband. They fit like tight glasses. The nose bridge is especially well designed. I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 stars because 1) the batteries it comes with aren't alkaline so I didn't use them. 2) the plastic inside the box it comes in wasn't recyclable. My personal choice is to start dinging manufacturers that don't use recyclable plastic.
customer_reviews.author: stevefoobar

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * The light functions well. * It is very inexpensive. Cons: * The nose bridge is uncomfortable. * The forehead pad does not keep the hard plastic away from the skin. * The inclusion of a 1.0x magnification lens is unnecessary. * Using it for a short time hurt my eyes. I ultimately purchased a more capable/comfortable replacement from Carson Optical.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Narrow field of view, fiddly to change lenses
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the Yoctosuns are good, not great. 1) Because the lenses are smallish, the field of view is fairly small (7" at 12") so that you have to point quite directly at your work. 2) The magnification range of the variety of lenses is nice, but switching them takes two hands 3) The light works quite well 4) They fit my head pretty well though like any snug glasses, will give a headache after several non-stop hours 5) The design and build appear to be robust. Wider lenses and a flip down auxiliary lens would make this perfect
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Andrew Huang

customer_reviews.title: Gave me a headache!
customer_reviews.text: The concept was a good one but it doesn't bear out in the actual product. I was wanting a headlight to replace using my headband miner's light and my reading glasses for close up work. This product was uncomfortable to wear. The nose pieces were uncomfortable even after adjusting them. The magnifying lenses were too cumbersome and it made me feel dizzy and, eventually, gave me a headache after wearing them for about 10 minutes because of the weight and the magnification. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: chuck rosales

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient magnifier
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that illuminates my close up work plus magnifies well. This unit is better than I had planned when I first started looking for a task light. Its bright enough. What really sold me was the multiple magnifications that are quickly changeable and the fact that this is a head mounted unit as compared to fixed task lighting solutions. Normally, I'll use this at a desk/task table, but I am already seeing times where I will use it on mobile tasks such as working on wiring in my truck, or machine repairs in the shop. I hope it lasts because I'm lining up a bunch of projects to use it on. May need to buy a second set.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Fixit

customer_reviews.title: The plastic components are too fragile.
customer_reviews.text: I used this lighted magnifier with the headband because the ear stems interfered with my glasses' ear stems. The plastic frame snapped near the juncture of where the strap attaches to the front, and was not fixable. The plastic is cheap and thin. It should be thicker at such a juncture. Also, I had a lot of trouble getting the light to turn on after changing batteries – there was a lot of flickering until the connection seemed to settle into working. I've used lighted magnifiers for over 15 years now and know how to use them. While these have nice lenses and are lightweight I would prefer a heavier plastic over fragility.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rose

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: For the price this seems reasonably built. I use it to replace watch batteries and there are several lens strengths you can use but I went right to the strongest. It has a built in led light but I use a halogen small table light. I would hate to try replacing a battery in a ladies watch without it. You can wear it like glasses like I do but it also comes with a band if you want to strap it on. It is somewhat adjustable but I just move the work of my head. I bought this plus a watch repair kit and battery assortment and figure I broke even after replacing my first battery.
customer_reviews.author: E Chester

customer_reviews.title: I really love this magnifier
customer_reviews.text: I really love this magnifier. As I have gotten older, it has become more difficult to see my needlepoint and other crafts. This one has the best magnification and light that I have used. I prefer using the elastic strap that came with it instead of the bows for over the years, but that's why they include the strap. The only negative that I have found is that the nose rest, while flexible is very hard and uncomfortable. But I fixed it by putting a small piece of glue backed foam on the nose piece and that solved that problem. If they just included a piece of foam in the kit, I would have given it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Mariamne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this. As a sculptor working in miniature, these are invaluable. It fits well and stays in place. The adjustable lens clip and the variety of interchangable lenses make its versatility the perfect magnifying tool for the price, which is just what I needed. I suppose if I turned out my studio lights, the built in light might prove useful, but with the ample lighting that I already have, it doesn't make a difference for me, so I don't use it, but the aforementioned features are what I need most anyway. This was an excellent buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Barfield

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use, light weight, various magnification power lenses.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Yoctosun unit for my wife and the older style jewelers loupe with glass lenses; wife now has the better / best unit! Lighter, brighter with light (old style has no light); generally speaking this head mount is the best in every category. Unit has LED lighting that is a double plus versus unit I purchased for myself; I have a floor pedestal lamp near me at all times, not so for my wife - a real winner for Yoctosun. If in doubt which to purchase, buy this one, so much better for the money. Not certain as to longevity, but time will tell (I am referencing the lighter plastic lenses).
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of "old-school" head-mounted magnifiers over the years, as I do lots of very small detail work. To be honest, I was skeptical about trying something so different from the norm; but so far, I am pleasantly surprised. They are very light & the variations in fitting should suit just about anyone. The light is adjustable & quite bright enough for anything within range of the glass. I was really impressed with the multiple magnification options but to go the extra mile, they include a tidy little case for storage and microfiber cloth to boot! I will put them to the test over time, but for now, it's all "thumbs up!"
customer_reviews.author: Svendi

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put batteries in place.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I'm having a hard time seeing some things up close. Plus my hubs always asks me to check him for splinters. I just can't focus that close to see things like that. It was really difficult to put the batteries in. I thought it was going to be a return but I eventually got the batteries to stay in place long enough to get the lid on. I found these aren't super comfy to wear more than 5mins. The weight hurts my nose. I also had to remove the rubber that goes over the ears as it would rip out my hair every time.
customer_reviews.author: glisteningcakes

customer_reviews.title: Great magnifier.
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. It works with my glasses. It is reasonably light weight. Best of all, it comes with 5 different lenses and I use all of them. The case for the lenses is great for keeping them clean and scratch free. At first I thought that I would just use one or at most two but I was wrong. The lens can be tilted up out of the way when you don't want the magnification. It is a great value. The only criticism that I would have would be that I wish the packaging could be used to store the magnifier with a lens attached. I modified the plastic insert a little so I could do that.
customer_reviews.author: R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: They work as advertised, but have lots of problems
customer_reviews.text: These have been invaluable to me for painting my miniatures, but I will be purchasing a different brand because there are several problems with this one. I don't know if I have an unusually large head or if it's made for smaller heads, but it is too small for me and there is no way to adjust the size. As a result, the glasses always slip down my nose because they're not held securely by my ears. Adjusting the nose clips does not help This could be remedied, although not comfortably, by including a strap to go on the back, but no strap was included. They are also not comfortable to wear for any length of time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, just not for my situation
customer_reviews.text: I wear glasses already, and use a magnifying lamp for my cross stitch work. Was hoping this magnifyer would work in place of the magnifying lamp and be more portable. Used it with the strap instead of the ear pieces. Couple issues. The light isn't as bright as I like. The magnifying lenses don't hang down very far from the headpiece, so I had to tilt my head way down for it to work. Wasn't that comfortable. Also the weight on my nose was hard to take for this headpiece plus my glasses. One set had to be lower on the nose and that hurt. This probably works well for people who don't wear glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Still On Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: I've had a chance to use this product on close up and small tasks that my senior eyes can't see as clearly as they used to. I have a jewelers hood that isn't very comfortable and has an old school yellow incandescent type bulb. This unit seems to fit relatively comfortable and the light is white/led and depending what you're looking at, a choice of multiple strength lens in a little box. I'll keep you posted if it turns out I totally love or not this new vision assistant. ***Update#1 Used max mag lens to clean dog ears and teeth today, 3 dogs so moderate usage period, the jury is still out.....
customer_reviews.author: D.B. Kracker

customer_reviews.title: VERY VERSATILE
customer_reviews.text: FIRST, THIS MAGNIFIER IS COMFORTABLE TO WEAR. I WORE IT FOR HOURS AS I WAS DOING CLOSEUP WORK . I HAVE READ OTHER COMPLAINTS ABOUT A NARROW FIELD OF VIEW, BUT WHEN YOU ARE FOCUSED ON THE WORK THE FIELD OF VIEW IS JUST FINE. THE CHANGEABLE LENSES ARE A PLUS. SOMETIMES YOU NEED JUST A LITTLE HELP OVER THE NAKED EYES, BUT OTHER TIMES YOU REALLY NEED TO GET CLOSE IN, LIKE REPAIRING ELECTRONICS. FINALLY THE CHANGE FROM BUTTON BATTERIES TO AAA ALLOWS YOU TO USE RECHARGEABLES AND SAVE MONEY IF YOU ARE USING THE LED LIGHT A LOT. THE LIGHT ITSELF IS ADEQUATE FOR MOST WORK. 4 STARS FOR NOW. DURABILITY WILL ADD ANOTHER STAR
customer_reviews.author: AL D

customer_reviews.title: Great Magnifyer without having to hold onto one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for miniature painting and getting those fine details. These work perfect. I find that the 2.x works best as it provides me with about 8-inches of good viewing. The added light is also nice to have. I don't use it much but having it there when I do need it is great! For the price you can't beat this. I removed the glasses arms and use the headband attachment. Fits much better this way. But I also have a circular head, so the arms were a tad tight on my temple area. Again using the included head band attachment eliminates this completely. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea K

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for any Estheticians or Crafter!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wear Bifocal prescription glasses and I do Lash Extensions and Lash Lifts. Needed something to help me see the lash line closer as my glasses have two different vision areas. Which disrupts my vision when I need to see something really up close. I got these and WOW!!! They really truly help bring the lash line closer to your vison field..esp the last thicker pair of lenses. These fit comfortably over my bifocal glasses..and love the light too. Definitely a must have for any one who does Lash extensions or Lash Lifts or just to see something really up close.
customer_reviews.author: KathyC

customer_reviews.title: Lenses are smaller than they seem
customer_reviews.text: I work at a hair transplant facility so I use head magnifiers in my line of work. The lenses are much smaller than anticipated so my peripheral vision is more visible and it clashes with the magnifiers and it gives me a headache. They are basically useless for my job if they are gonna affect me that much so I don't like them. Do they work? yeah they do. But it depends on what you're using them for.
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Good light and magnification
customer_reviews.text: With aging eyes, I sometimes need magnification for fine work. These glasses provide that with additional light to boot. Company's turn around time on the order was very prompt, and the item arrived well packaged. The light is sufficiently bright, and the multiple levels of magnification are very useful. The balance of the glasses when wearing them, though, is slightly off, which would be distracting, I think, if I tried to wear them constantly. They do what they were advertised to do, and overall I'm very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jrb1021

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS ITEM!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic! My husband uses them to look at his atlases. I use them to examine my plants with the magnifiers on and without the magnifiers, they help me use my rifle sights better. It's a very cool, unexpected bonus. I love the light, too! It's a different kind of light than the sun provides, so it gives a different view of the plants' leaves. You can see pests like spider mites much easier. It's also lightweight. I love that! I have had headlamps that weighed so much they gave me a headache. This is perfect! I LOVE THIS ITEM! I will be buying it again!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Bondor

customer_reviews.title: A life saver for needle work
customer_reviews.text: I use this magnifier when doing embroidery, and it has saved my eyes! The strongest magnifier (it comes with a bunch of lenses with various magnifications) allows me to see exactly where my needle is going and gives a good look at the stitching. I feel that my work looks a lot better since I can see it so much better with this magnification. It comes with an elastic headband and with earpieces like glasses. I started off using the elastic, but ended up using the ear pieces since I take the magnifier off and put it back on pretty frequently. This is a must have for anyone who does close up work.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hammerschmidt

customer_reviews.title: nose piece is very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are very light weight and the light is perfect, very bright. The lenses are extremely clear but a little undersized in my opinion. The worst part is the nose bridge. Its just a piece of tin covered in a very thin layer of plastic and starts to hurt in seconds. And I wear glasses full time so I'm use to something resting on my nose. Also on that point, wearing them over my glasses is possible but even more uncomfortable, however I was pleasantly surprised to find they worked well for me with my glasses removed. My advice is to order nose pads along with the magnifiers and you will find you like these as well as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these in April 2018. Up until today (Jan 13th, 2020) I was very pleased with the product. This morning as I was putting the lenses on, the right 'arm' snapped cleanly in the area between the magnification area and where the swivel for the arm is located - see photo. Needless to say, I was quite surprised as they've never felt brittle or stiff indicating older age plastic. They do work well and I would recommend them to prospective buyers with the note - be very careful when putting on or taking off. I did make an attempt to write this note via the Yoctosun website with no success.
customer_reviews.author: tjw

customer_reviews.title: Yoctosun Head Mount Magnifier - Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product through the advice of a friend, who ordered it to do repair work on his software items that require magnifying to see what he is working on. He suggested I get one for our son who paints Warhammer figures that are very detailed and have very tiny details. He is very much a perfectionist and paints them very well; however, I felt this would work well for him so he doesn't have to squint to paint. I got this for his birthday, so he hasn't used it yet. My friend loves his and showed it to us. My husband and I were very impressed with the quality and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl K. Crescenzi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for crafts and in my garden (trying my hand at cross-pollinating). I figured they'd be okay to use with my glasses if nothing else. I tried them out about a week after they arrived and OMG, I don't even need my glasses (readers) at all. I love the sturdy construction (I know because I dropped them as soon as I opened the box and then again about an hour later), sturdy enough to fall on tile and survive! Easy to change out the lenses, comes with a great storage case for said lenses and a nice strap. I'd buy again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: bunny

customer_reviews.title: I love this gizmo
customer_reviews.text: I love the angular flexibility on this Yoctosun head mount magnifying alien technology I can not only tilt the lens but I can also tilt the two LED lights which was one of my concerns prior to buying this gizmo. I was also concerned about the weight with the 3 triple A batteries being a burden to my nose bridge however in my case it was not a problem. I don't know why it feels heavy for some users for me I hardly know it's on my face and I could easily run around the block without it falling off my face just remember to bend open or adjust the nose bridge holder.
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: I will have to admit I didn’t expect much for the price but boy was I wrong. I just wanted a low cost magnifier that if I laid them down and stepped on them I wouldn’t be out much. The case with the different magnifications is well built and the lenses have a ice clear grind and work like much more expensive u it’s. The headset seems a bit fragile in a few locations and a little loose hinges so we will see about durability. For the price I would recommend to even a professional that needs them for work.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not made or the highest quality materials, but for the money these work great. They’re a little tricky to position with glasses, but they do fit. The lenses are surprisingly good for the money. I use these for both watchmaking and electronics and, without spending considerably more, I don’t think there’s a better solution out there. The only criticism I have is the optional elastic headband couldn’t possibly made for an adult head, so that’s useless. Beyond that flaw, this is the best you’ll get anywhere near this price-range.
customer_reviews.author: "makfu"

customer_reviews.title: I like them...
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived undamaged. These things are awesome. They work really well and I was very surprised how bright the little leds lights were. Doesn't feel too heavy when wearing them and I like the option of having the ability to switch out the magnifying lenses. I read here that some people wear their glasses when they are using this item, I have not tried that as I don't see a need to do so. I just wish the magnifying glasses were just a bit wider... or maybe I just need a smaller head..lol Give them a try. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: G. Currie

customer_reviews.title: Great for crafting
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend this product if 1) your eyes are over 40-45 years old, 2) you work with fine detail such as small cuts/paint/type etc, and you don't want to spend hundreds of dollars on a durable prescription pair of surgical loupes. These are light weight, don't slide off my head, very adjustable to match your field of vision and necessary magnification. The plastic is very hard and light-- so my concerns are comfort over hours of uninterrupted wear, and concern for breakage (I immediately bought a case to store when not in use). Overall, good value!
customer_reviews.author: J. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, pushy seller
customer_reviews.text: Got the item over a month ago, and a week ago I gave the item five stars, since then I have received two emails letting me know my package arrived “a few days ago” and asking for a review, apparently the five star rating isn’t enough. Product is great, it works as described and I have not had the issues with the battery compartment that others have mentioned. I like that the light can be moved around and it was great that it came with batteries. It is definitely a little heavy in the front with the batteries but it’s manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great help to aging eyes!
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this to see if it would help me be able to cut my own toenails again. I am 67 years old with some mobility issues. This has made the job doable for me, and the light is a big plus. I also plan to use it to help me do my counted cross stitch. I like that I could even use is to read at night in case of a power outage. Good investment for me.
customer_reviews.author: sue zee

customer_reviews.title: Works great but a little concerning.....
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for 10 days now and twice I've experienced a very loud pop and burst of air on my face from the unit. Not sure if this is something to be concerned about although it is VERY startling when it occurs. I do needlework and purchased mine so I would be able to see the small stitch areas easily. I love the interchangeable lenses and the light shines brightly on my work when I'm in need of added illumination but the loud popping noise is very concerning!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: It does what is supposed to do. I liked it as I was surprised as it is priced very low. The lenses are clear and well done without the monster distortions some alternatives present. I did not found optics quality difference from top named brand. But the feel of the set is something extremely cheap and fragile. It doesn't look to be done for actual professional use, but, of course, I can be wrong. Actually I hope I am wrong and this stuff can deliver me the work I need in the next years. Anyway, so far, so good. For the price of this it is difficult to make a wrong purchase. Great value. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo Cristo

customer_reviews.title: This makes a great reading light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 90 year old mother who has a lifetime love for reading. In the past I purchased either a light or magnifying glass to help her with nighttime reading. What’s great about this device is, she can have a light and magnifier to help her read and it’s hands free so there’s no problem holding the book with two hands. Not sure if this was the intended purpose of the device but it does a great job of helping older book readers, especially at night. Highly recommended !
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hands-free magnification
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this magnifier for my wife who likes doing puzzles. The puzzle pieces are sometimes very small and it's difficult to see tiny details. This hands-free magnifier was just what she needed. She attached the lens that was appropriate for her vision and has been completely satisfied with this product. I almost gave this product 4 stars because the 3 AAA batteries didn't last very long; however, I replaced the batteries and the 2 small LED lights shine very bright. It's a decent product that I can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: If you use reading glasses remember that this headset sits on your nose and you cannot use both at the same time. My old headset didn't sit on my nose so I would keep my reading glasses on and just flip down the lens to amplify the magnification. Multiple lenses used simultaneously add up together to magnify your vision. So my reading glasses at 1.5x + the headset at 2.0x would give me 3.5x magnification. I ended up removing the nose bridge on the headset but the screw mounts would poke my forehead, so I added a small piece of foam padding and now they work well.
customer_reviews.author: John Viera

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for hands free detail work
customer_reviews.text: As inexpensive as these were, I'm absolutely amazed at how well they work. The different lenses that allow you to tailor how much magnification you need is great, and the little LED work light is wonderfully bright. I had been working on a miniature model that was giving me headaches, and frustrating me with trying to use a fixed position magnifying glass. These allow me to work with both hands, and the extra bright work light is a wonderful aid. I definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: med1pilot

customer_reviews.title: Super than expected
customer_reviews.text: OMG if I could give this a 20 I would. I bought this for a craft project because I couldn’t see numbers the were small a this product was superior compared to what I expected. I bought it based on reviews and I had to say I didn’t believe them so had to find out on my own. The instructions are fair but the batteries go into the part that goes on your ears & has to be firmly inserted. It comes with 5 eyeglass lens & you pick one the fits best. Then wear them like eyeglasses. Well made
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Could not install batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I could not install the batteries. I tried for a half hour and finally gave up. The battery compartment is very poorly designed. I have trouble seeing very small things and the tasks I will use this for don't need the light - things like threading a needle. So I am not returning it. But if you need the light don't buy this item. If you do buy it and are able to install the batteries I recommend you use alkaline batteries because of the difficulty installing them. It came with heavy duty which won't last as long.
customer_reviews.author: CSF

customer_reviews.title: I can see now
customer_reviews.text: I love these, very useful for eyes older then 50. I do fine wire weaving and jewelry making. Even with my trifocals on I cannot see the wires well. These glasses came to the rescue. I don't always use the light because I have another bright light I work under. The light is great because it uses batteries easy to find. There are 4 different lenses that can be used. I am able to work now and see even the smallest wires and see fine jewelry pieces. I can now work with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I have been looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with these magnifying glasses. I do a lot of hand stitching. The head piece comes with multi lenses with are easily changeable. I have use three different lenses based on the degree of closeup work I an doing. The light is perfect and points directly at the work in hand. The unit is very light and easy to wear for over and hour at a time. I t comes with a head strap, which I use, that really relieved the pressure on my nose. That is my one small suggestion---more padding on the nose piece. The price is sure right.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela A. Monge

customer_reviews.title: The trade off...
customer_reviews.text: So, the model before this one was super light weight, but the batteries lasted only a few hours. It also had a week magnification lens mount. This model has fixed the lens mount and is much more sturdy. The battery life for the light is pretty amazing. The trade off for this is a noticeably heavier head set that can dig into your nose after a while. Overall, I love this headset and I think it is well worth the price. I recommend this purchase for the hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: A Great Vision Aid for This Retiree
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retiree with a diabetic black cat. So my vision isn't the best. I need to take a blood sample several times a day to check my cat's blood glucose readings. With my cat being black and the small amount of blood that is required, sometimes it is difficult to see the blood droplet on her fur. These glasses have made all the difference in the world for me. The magnifications are clear as a bell and the built in light is a plus. For me these glasses have been a great aid and I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone who needs a little help with their vision.
customer_reviews.author: Snapshot46

customer_reviews.title: A lot of bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised by the features and quality, especially at the low price - six sets of magnifying lenses in varying magnifications (and comes with a nice case for them). Glasses-style earpieces can be changed out for the included headband. Very adjustable for lens distance and for the angle of the light. I wish the light was a little brighter, but overall this is a great item. I use mine for craft projects, soldering small parts, and many other things. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Cheap and perfect for detailing 3d prints. I also put on my 3m mask and do some detailed airbrushing. Get some good laughs at the selfie wearing these glasses plus a gas mask haha. So far I’ve worn them just about every day for a couple of weeks and the batteries have lasted a while. I bought extra batteries because I figured they would run down quickly however to my surprise, they haven’t. The presentation of the different lenses and the cleaning cloth was a nice bonus. I’d recommend this product to anyone looking to do close up work.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Works with Glasses, Good weight.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for about 3 hours after receiving the product yesterday. The magnification is great, the Light is bright, though it gets warm to the touch, not overly so. The battery compartment is leaves a little to be desired as the wiring and construction are just adequate. Some care is required when loading batteries to make sure the very delicate wiring isn't affected. Overall the weight wasn't noticeable. I'm pretty sure I will have to re-wire the light or at least re-solder the battery contact wires at some point, but the magnification lenses are nice, the case is sturdy, and the microfiber cleaning cloth was a nice touch. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: James Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Helped me adjust kids orthodontic expander
customer_reviews.text: My child has an orthodontic expander which requires inserting a paperclip size diameter "key" into a tiny hole located in the back of the roof of the mouth. The first day was nervewracking, as I could barely see the hole and my kid was nervous I would hurt him. After I received this, the expansions were easy and I could see what I was doing. I also ordered some orange tinted safety lenses for my child so he wouldn't be blinded by the led on this light.
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: You need this-put down the magnifying glass and flashlight.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great very handy thing to own. I have spent so many times trying to fix something with a flashlight in one hand and a magnifying glass in the other. They seem to have thought this out when they produced it because it will do just about everthing you would need something like this for. I hope that it holds up well. Time will tell. It came packed very well and the sent batteries and written directions with illustrations (this is very rare nowdays)
customer_reviews.author: LDW

customer_reviews.title: I love these GLASSES!!!
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are OUTSTANDING!!! I received my order yesterday. I got a wooden splinter in my right index finger today. I used these glasses with the highest magnification lens and I could see the embedded splinter so clearly! It was successfully removed in seconds, using pointed tweezers with my left hand. I never could have accomplished this with a traditional magnifying glass. You need to hold those with one hand, preventing working on the splinter. This is actually why I purchased these glasses... The ability to use both of my hands with splinter removals. I do a lot of yard work in AZ and these are a Godsend!
customer_reviews.author: S. Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: More than worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This product is great and very functional for such inexpensive price. I've used it for soldering on pc boards, and the magnification is perfect for this type of project. I don't think I would have had much success with soldering if I hadn't used this. Before I purchased this, I was using a Harbor Freight mini clamp/magnifying glass kit, and was very cumbersome to work with. I bought his product along with a Circuit Board Holder I also purchased from Amazon, and it just made the job so much easier. I would highly recommend this product for soldering and for doing detailed work on very tiny parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice design but incredibly heavy
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly heavy especially once batteries are in. It gave me a headache. The product design appears to be rather sturdy which is nice and would work well if you have small projects that do not take too much time. I require the use of it long term as in several hours at a time. Therefore the weight is not ideal for me, which was a shame since I really wanted to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Sly

customer_reviews.title: Need Magnification?
customer_reviews.text: Trying to remove a splinter? Can't read the fine print on labels? Can't see to replace a tiny screw in glasses? Replacing a link pin on a wristwatch. This set of jeweler's glasses solve every conceivable problem when magnification is needed. The price is amazing considering that the package comes with well made glasses frame, lighting, several different glasses lens in a closable carrying case, and a microfibre cleaning cloth. I've bought many different items on Amazon, but I don't think that I've purchased an item that is more useful. This is a steal at the current price. It would be a great buy at five times the price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and effective. Batteries make it heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try for working on detailed plastic models after previously using the style that has a band around the head. I always found that annoying because it would get hot and sweaty. This is much better and more comfortable, and it's easy to take on/off if you want to switch from general to detailed tasks. It's also nice to have a range of different lenses, although I typically just use the highest power. The only annoyance is that the light uses 3AAA batteries. With these in place, it makes the unit a little too heavy and reduces the comfort, so I don't use the built-in light and just use external task lighting instead.
customer_reviews.author: ChillKodama

customer_reviews.title: Issues! But it does the job...
customer_reviews.text: First off, I had to go and buy batteries- which, is fine... but, it came with batteries and they were bad. Ultimately meaning, I thought initially the light itself, didn’t work! Also, for those who really need this kind of equipment ( it’s hard to see little little writing) and this piece riddled with little writing, so be aware of this! And the nose guard is a bit uncomfortable too! But, overall it does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MULTIPLE USES...ESPECIALLY READING GLASS!
customer_reviews.text: You will not regret...i love them, didn't try all the lens, first time china got it right! China is the bootleg capital of the world! Why amazon don't open up a store like Sears who use to sell reliability! Don't be like the greedy Walton's and Rothchild's so many selfish billions destroying the earth......
customer_reviews.author: ELECTRIC225

customer_reviews.title: Great magnifying headset at good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great magnifying headset at a reasonable price. The lenses are optically good for the price point, and can easily be swapped out. They are for close work and have a near focal point. Additionally, their exact position can be adjusted to suit your working style (for example, they can be tilted to accommodate looking downward). The LED leaves something to be desired as it creates a hot spot, and would benefit from a diffuser. Your can easily add or remove the headband. All in all, I'd call it a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Finally got a pair
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to see these on Prime day, have wanted to get a pair for some time. With them being on sale, I purchased. And I am happy that I did. They are very lightweight, the light is fairly bright and can be moved. The fact that there are 5 different lens is fabulous. And if I want or need to use a strap to keep them on, it is provided. The way to take off ear pieces and attach is great. Everything is adjustable a big plus
customer_reviews.author: Charlette

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. Unable to assemble or or take apart as directed.
customer_reviews.text: Was unable to remove ear peaces to attach head band. Ordered 2 different modals. Was sent 4. Batteries present in 2 packages Only. Batteries fit poorly. Unable to close battery packs. Very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I wasn’t expecting this to be all that great...but hopefully could get the job done. Was I wrong! This item is worth every penny!! Comes with several lenses so I’m able to adjust it for my vision. If you’re looking for a magnifier, you cannot go wrong with this one!! ❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLIFY YOUR LIFE
customer_reviews.text: With advanced age, and waning eyesight, it is a pain to read medicine bottles, product instructions, recipe instructions. I believe these items are printed for elves to read.. I do not have an elf, so this item is such an improvement to my everyday life. The lights are awesome. You can change from the blue to the brighter to fit the situation. Will order another to keep as backup or to share with other family members in my situation Hmmm, Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Plants

customer_reviews.title: Works & Fits Well
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw the picture of these in the ad, they looked as if they'd be heavy and clumsy when wearing them. They aren't. They actually fit pretty well and are comfortable enough to wear for a while. I've used them for several things, including working with tiny iPhone parts. They come with a set of lenses, but personally, I find the lower-magnification lenses to be of little use and always use the largest magnification ones. I also didn't think I'd use the integrated LED light much, but am finding it pretty handy.
customer_reviews.author: moomadoo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for building coils.
customer_reviews.text: I gifted these to my husband early. Yes, I have done that 3 times in these reviews but dont worry! He has presents waiting for him, for Christmas too. Santa will bring them. But my hubby works on vape mods and for our business, too. He says these were PERFECT for seeing tiny details on building coils and whatnot...he LOVES these. They do such a good job. They really magnify and light up the tiny details when working with tiny details.
customer_reviews.author: LadyStanleyCup

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought these sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I do hobby wrist watch work and decided to give these a try. These are amazing!!! I should have purchased them sooner. The light is very bright but not so bright that you can’t see what you are working on. The interchangeable lenses with varying magnifications makes these extremely versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: i look cheesy but who cares!
customer_reviews.text: ok so i'll admit it ... my eyes aren't what they used to be! I love doing my own manicures at home, but lately it's been a struggle. I get out a small lamp, my glasses, and even still I have a hard time really seeing well. So I was at the dentist recently and hello, lightbulb! I thought why can't I find little glasses like my dentist has for doing my nails?? I found these glasses on amazon and they're perfect!! The whole family loves them, actually. My kids are into coin collecting, so they love to borrow my glasses to inspect their coins.
customer_reviews.author: Yabby02

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great product - affordable price! The lenses have a plastic storage case. It's lighted and uses AAA batteries (easy to find!). It is plastic - can't be too rough with it -- but it's not fragile. Very adjustable. Has a headband that you can use instead of the ear pieces. This is a very good value. In fact, we bought two more because my husband wanted one, too, and he wanted to have a spare - just in case. : )
customer_reviews.author: KeesMom

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable with eyeglasses
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product is very uncomfortable to wear. I am using it to make jewelry. I do wear glasses and when I put the magnifying lens down, it is difficult to pinpoint the best distance for optimal focus. I use the elastic band but in a short time my glasses shift and my head is sore. The light is helpful but I think I’m better off with my headlight I bought for camping. It is well priced and well made and I would recommend if u don’t wear glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Untethered

customer_reviews.title: I like them but they are not durable
customer_reviews.text: I do like these magnifiers but one of the arms broke off after 16 months of infrequent use. My only other complaint is that putting batteries in to power the LED light makes the set too uncomfortable to wear. There is just too much weight. Even without the batteries is can get a bit uncomfortable after along period. Still for the price I was happy to use them and I liked the ergonomics of the set. I'm planning on replacing these with something more substantial, like the Carson Optical Pro Series.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for sewing and crafts
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my mother as she does tons of crafts after she used them once we are buying one for everyone in the family. Aunts for sewing, dad for mechanical repair, and grandparents of needling and even reading their medicine bottles. The light is awesome and the various lenses help you to choose what you need to see. They do get a little heavy after wearing them for a while but a slight adjustment and you are back to good!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: My husband is very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about this purchase, having no experience with such tools myself. My husband plays War Hammer so a friend suggested these glasses as a Christmas present and it was my husband's favorite. He feels like he can see way more detail and the lights even help him see colors better. He likes that it's adjustable. I would say it's a great gift for model painters.
customer_reviews.author: A_Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled for a long time to see details when working on soldering and other small projects. I happen to catch someone on YouTube wearing these and thought I'd try them. Now I can see VERY well. The light helps. I don't always use it but it is useful. Moreover being able to snap in and out the lenses is great and the storage container they come in will ensure they stay scratch free. Ultimately I'm beyond happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Great magnifier light.
customer_reviews.text: I paint miniature figures and have terrible eyesight which gets worse with age. Wanted a new magnifier lens with a light and this one was recommended by several people I know. It fits nicely. The lenses snap in and out easily and come with nice storage case and cleaning cloth. The light is bright and perfectly directed at what I’m working on. Has both eyeglass arms or an elastic strap if you prefer. My one complaint is that it’s a bit heavy with the batteries in and weighs on my nose a bit after a few hours of use. But so much better to help me see and improve my work.
customer_reviews.author: Hermeticgamer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I wanted it to do, with an extra benefit that there is enough space between the lens and the frame that I can watch TV while working without having the flip the lens up. Only complaint is that it's heavy and the thin pads hurt the bridge of my nose after a while. Lenses are way easier to change out compared to an Optivisor.
customer_reviews.author: Glen R. Senkowski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for close work
customer_reviews.text: These "glasses" are excellent for when I'm making jewelry. The interchangeable lenses are clear with no distortion. I can even wear them over my regular glasses. The best features are the very comfortable nose pads and the light. The light is adjustable. I had looked at similar magnifiers for almost twice the price. These have all the same features. One other nice thing is that the lenses come in a storage box to protect them from scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Xwickslady

customer_reviews.title: Fits adequate but...
customer_reviews.text: These magnifiers work just fine. But since I wear prescription glasses, and am not able to wear both, one eye is always out of focus. If I had one wish, it would be the increased magnification: greater than 3.5 power. Anything less for me is useless. Would I recommend them? It depends on the application. I suspect that, and since I will not be returning them, I will be re-configuring them to be able to wear both pairs at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: woodmandog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Microblading and Fibroblasting
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! It is light when you wear it as I have purchased others that are very heavy and ended up getting migraines. It helps with doing upclose work as in Microblading, PMU lips and eyeliner. I know longer need myagnifying lamp stand which at times seriously gets in the way. I will be purchasing more of these in the near future. Thank you for a great product! I have now purchased a total of 3 and everybody on my team loves the magnifiers! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Couch

customer_reviews.title: Would of paid DOUBLE the price
customer_reviews.text: I like EVERYTHING about this product! I ordered one for my husband to use when he sodders tiny stuff for his electronics, I liked it as much as he did, so ordered myself one to use for adult coloring books. It's perfect to stay in the lines with. Well worth every penny & have recommended to everyone I think could use one!! The only thing I don't quite understand is it said " 2 jeweler loupes" included?? It did come with a box of different magnification lenses, 5 of them actually, so not complaining AT ALL, just wondering the "2 jeweler loupes" means?
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but a bit fragile
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this successfully to do soldering. The nose piece is uncomfortable on the nose - it could use some extra padding. I finally switched to the wraparound headband to reduce weight on my nose, which made it a tad more comfortable to use. Finally one of the arms snapped off, making it unuseable. I'm trying to repair it now with JBWeld as I type this review. Overall, its a good magnifier that does the job, especially for the price. I'd pay a little more if they could make the arms stronger and less susceptible to breakage.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good for soldering
customer_reviews.text: I completely agree with other reviews in that these are rather heavy but quality! Padded nose-bridge and five lenses that are easy to pop in and out as needed. I use these primarily for soldering and almost went with a table-mount. Nope, glad I didn't. Sure, these have a smaller field of vision but you can't really tell when you are focused on the task at hand. I am nearsighted and was worried about the comments stating that they might have problems for those with glasses. Nope. No trouble. Glad that the lenses flip IN so, with the headband? I can put my glasses on and just slide these up on my head and swap out when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my optic visors that give me a headache to wear because the band pressure around my head. Also, something that I could see through and enlarge the jewelry piece I'm working on. These fit the criteria perfectly. I can see clearly out of the magnified lenses and no headache. They are very comfortable to wear too. The case for the lenses is great too. they keep the lenses clean and protected from loss or from scratches. The light on top is bright too. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Cummings

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: This product is just right for the price does what i need it to . it is built of light weight plastic take 3 triple a batteries for light . interchanging lens are good different powers. comes with a head ban also for stay on head angles. overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
